newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan BSPA buys 54,000 tonnes soybeans at tender.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan BSPA buys 54,000 tonnes soybeans at tender.

text.p: The Kaohsiung division of Taiwan's Breakfast Soybean Procurement Association bought a 54,000-tonne shipment of U.S. soybeans from U.S. grain supplier Continental at a tender on Friday, traders said.
The tender had specified that the soybeans could be sourced in the United States, Brazil or Argentina, traders said.
The Brazilian and Argentine offer prices were not low enough to be competitive with the U.S. grain, traders said.
Traders said the tender was likely to lure other Taiwan soy buyers into the market, particularly the unaffiliated Taichung division of the Breakfast Soybean Procurement Association.
The Breakfast association's Taichung division consists of Sino Japan Feed Corp, Chia Hsin, Formosa Oilseed, Fwu Sow Grain, and Tay Shan.
The shipment was bought on a cost-and-freight basis.
Details for the tender are as follows:
